message_1:
Find the equation of the Calabi-Yau variety given by the complex zeroes of the polynomial:

$$ f(x,y,z) = x^3+y^3+z^3-3xyz $$
message_2:
The Calabi-Yau variety is defined as the set of complex solutions (x, y, z) to the given polynomial equation f(x, y, z) = 0, where f(x, y, z) is a homogeneous polynomial of degree 3. In this case, the polynomial is already given:

$$ f(x,y,z) = x^3+y^3+z^3-3xyz $$

The Calabi-Yau variety is the set of complex solutions (x, y, z) such that:

$$ x^3+y^3+z^3-3xyz = 0 $$

This equation represents the Calabi-Yau variety in the complex projective space P^2.
